If we do enter into a true depression or even an all out war, the lowest low will likely be short-lived. A few years, tops. It will be how we deal with that period ‚Äî and the rebound ‚Äî that makes all the difference.

Things will continue to feel a bit more expensive each year, but significantly more expensive in 5-10.

The cost of goods and services will continue to rise, widening the gap between economic classes and continuing to cut out much of the previously middle class.

It‚Äôs entirely possible that the United States may be on the verge of a steep and extended downturn, with many obstacles ahead.

My guess: we‚Äôre most likely to experience a gradual but steady ride down the economic ladder in terms of purchasing power of the dollar.

#1: don't invest more than you can afford to lose

5.) This is actually a good time to get in if you‚Äôve been sitting on the sidelines. It‚Äôs not tolerable for things to keep going up and up indefinitely without dipping. This is still a growing asset class. We need corrections.

4.) The biggest companies in the world are becoming blockchain companies (FB to Meta, Square to Block). The day-to-day is scary but if you believe in the future that these billionaires do, the industry will be fine. Follow the money.

3.) Remember the difference between risk and volatility. What we are seeing now is the extreme volatility of crypto. This is part of the game. That‚Äôs why it is a marathon, not a sprint. Where is the capital going long term? Do you see the dollar being a truly safer bet? I don‚Äôt.

2.) Most of the big cap stuff is still doing fairly well. Top 10 stuff, all things considered. ETH stayed pretty solid IMO. Let‚Äôs not forget it was $500 in January. Don‚Äôt freak out about it being $4k (down from $4.7k ATH) now. Crazy gains.

Crypto market is taking a huge correction. A few things to notice: 

1.) BTC hit an ATH last month at $69k. It‚Äôs now down in the mid-40‚Äôs. This is still up nearly 3X on the year (Jan was $17k). It may dip more. Maintain perspective. What other assets are doing these numbers?

That way, you're betting on the future on the industry as a whole, not just one platform you hope wins.

A strong portfolio would have BTC, ETH and 3-5 strong competitors of ETH + some "small caps" in an area like gaming.

HODL and take profits when necessary.

You're set.

These are all platforms which can power dapps, NFTs + other projects important to the development of Web3 biz.

Therefore, a strong portfolio would not be maximalist on any specific platform. It would look at ETH, then look at all the strong competitors and bet on ALL of them.

But the ETH platform has issues: slow, expensive in $$ and energy. It will continue to maintain "first mover" advantage unless they fuck up royally. But there's so much potential in the market, competitors creep in.

Among them: SOL, AVAX, DOT, ALGO, FTM and many more.

My crypto portfolio strategy / logic:

Web3 means that blockchain technology takes center stage. Just like the growth of social media apps across mobile devices, dapps will become the center of this boom.

ETH is the current leader in this race to build dapps.
Crypto isn‚Äôt tanking. It‚Äôs a Black Friday sale üåä
